channel.title: GitHub on David Wesst
channel.description: Recent content in GitHub on David Wesst

item.title: How Github Makes Game Making Easier for Noncoders
item.description: In this video, DW goes through five things he’s been using in Github while designing his latest prototype that require zero coding skills. GitHub is a social development platform that will make your game development journey easier even if you’re not a coder! We’ll cover how GitHub can help keep your file history, through to how it can help organize your work, and even where to find cool projects to learn (and possibly contribute to).

item.title: How to Blog with VSTS (Part 2)
item.description: This is part 2 of 5 of my How to Blog with VSTS series. Links to the other parts will be added as they are made available. Part 1: Setup Part 2: Code Part 3: Work Part 4: Build Part 5: Release I’ve been tinkering with Visual Studio Team Services off and on since its public release, but never did anything really productive with it. Over the past couple of weeks, I finally bit the bullet and decided to move my most prevelant personal project into VSTS: this blog.
